active_brain_modal.title: Activate Brain
active_brain_modal.description:
Are you sure you want to activate Brain?
This will cause your triggers to be replaced by Actions and this can directly affect the operation of your agent.

deactivate_brain_modal.title: Deactivate Brain

Are you sure you want to deactivate Brain?
This will cause your actions to be replaced by triggers and this can directly affect the functioning of your bot.

evaluate.add_sentences_intent: Add more sentences for the intent
evaluate.precision_description: A perfect precision score of 1.0 means that all test results were positive.

evaluate-manual.header_title_p: Manually add test sentences, simulating end-user input, to assess the quality of AI-trained sentences.
evaluate-manual.tips_title: Tips for taking an effective test
evaluate-manual.tips_description: Try to add real test phrases, but which have never been seen by the model (different phrases from the trained ones). This will allow you to test whether your AI really can abstract and understand the meaning of the intents it has been trained to correctly classify a never-before-seen test sentence.
evaluate-manual.test_title: Take a new manual phrase test
evaluate-manual.test_p: Run a new manual test, adding phrases that simulate actual end-user input.
evaluate-manual.header_title_p2: Using our testing feature, you can evaluate your bot's performance easily.

evaluate-automatic-new.header_title_p: With each new interaction, a new analysis of the phrases is automatically carried out to assess whether the AI is working properly.

result.evaluate_output_text: For more information about test results, see our
result.recall_reports_text: A perfect precision score of 1.0 means that every test result was positive (but says nothing about whether all positive results were retrieved) whereas a perfect recall score of 1.0 means that all positive results were retrieved by the search (but says nothing about how many false positives were also retrieved).
result.added_entity: Added entities | Added entity | Added entities
result.intent_confusion_matrix_text: The confusion matrix shows you which intents are mistaken for others. Read more about it in our
result.intent_confidence_distribution_text: The histogram allows you to visualize the confidence distribution for all predictions, with the volume of correct and incorrect predictions being displayed by green and red bars respectively. Improving the quality of your training data will move the green histogram bars to the right and the red histogram bars to the left of the plot.
result.sentence_details_text: Compare the results in every test sentence
result.error: There was an error retrieving the sentences

bases.description: The Knowledge bases are text sources for a Content Intelligence. Distribute the text of the intelligence in bases, gathering on each one similar informations. Find out more on our documentation.

bases.api_guide: How to integrate to Weni Flows or Rapidpro
bases.api_integrate: How to integrate to Weni Flows or Rapidpro
bases.api_integrate_step_one_text: On Weni Flows or Rapidpro, open or create a new flow.
bases.api_integrate_step_two_text: Insert a new flow box and select the option called 'Call webhook'
bases.api_integrate_step_three_text: Select Post and insert the URL provided above
bases.api_integrate_step_four_text: On ‚ÄúHTTP Headers‚Äù add the Access Token provided above, with the word Bearer included.
bases.api_integrate_step_five_text: Click on POST Body and insert the code above related to the Post BODY. You can replace the quoted texts for variables.
bases.api_integrate_step_final_text: Following these steps you will integrate your Artificial Intelligence.

summary.intent_question: INTENT is what the chatbot will detect as being the user's intention when sending a specific message. For example: when sending "thank you", the user's intention is to show gratitude. So the intent for that sentence could be "thanks".
summary.entity_question: ENTITY is the noun related to the desire that was detected by the chatbot. For example: If the user-submitted phrase is "generate new report," the entity could be "report" or "new report"
summary.entity_groups_info: Noun related to desire that was detected by intelligence. For example: if the phrase sent by the user is ‚Äúgenerate new report‚Äù, the entity can be ‚Äúreport‚Äù or ‚Äúnew report‚Äù.
summary.intents_list_info: The desire that intelligence perceives that the user has when sending a message. For example: when sending ‚Äúthank you‚Äù the user's intent is to show gratitude. Thus, the intent could be ‚Äúthanks‚Äù.
summary.intelligence_force_info: There are 3 levels of strength: weak, regular and strong. The greater the number of phrases per intent, the balance between the intents and the number of test phrases, the greater your strength, which represents how well the intelligence is trained.

integration.title: API
integration.description: Integrate this intelligence with Weni flows in just one click, see complete documentation on how to use this feature, you can also access our API's of artificial intelligence.
integration.http_title: Make an HTTP request to the NLP service, following the example below
integration.url_description: The base URL is the root URL of the API, that is, it is the initial address to access the functionalities and available resources. It's like the starting point for exploring and interacting with the API.
integration.headers_description: Authentication is one of the most important header types in API requests. It provides information about the authentication of the user making the request, ensuring that the API can correctly identify the user and verify that the user has permission to make the request.
integration.post_body_description: The POST Body is a part of the API request that contains the data sent to perform a certain task, such as user message information. It is important that it is formatted correctly in JSON so that the API can process the information properly.
integration.response_description: An API response is the response that the API sends back information to the client that made a request. It's like a message that the API sends back to the user, with the requested information or indicating an error that occurred during the processing of the request.
integration.news_text: Integrate this intelligence to Weni Fluxos with one click, on the page of

options.title: Bothub Pricing
options.slogan: Bothub hosts intelligences that work for you
options.free_text: Gain access to the community intelligence repository, create intelligence, and invite people to collaborate on your project. In this mode you have up to 1000 free predictions.
options.professional_text: Gain access to the community intelligence repository, create intelligence, and invite people to collaborate on your project. In this mode you pay, after reaching 1,000 predictions.
options.custom_text: Real superpowers! Take your wits to the next level with personalized solutions, impeccable support, and a large number of predictions.

info.title: Payment information
info.subtitle: Input your credit or debit card information

tutorial.title: Welcome to Bothub
tutorial.description:
Bothub is an open platform for forecasting, training and share NLP data sets in multiple languages.

Follow these steps to be part of our community
tutorial.alert_message: You need to follow the sequence of steps
tutorial.training_error: There was an error in training your intelligence.
tutorial.training_success: Your intelligence has been successfully trained!

items.integrate: Integrate your intelligence with a platform

create_intelligence.step_0: You can use one of the intelligences of the repository by choosing and clicking on one of them.
create_intelligence.step_1: Or create your own intelligence by clicking here.

create_intelligence_forms.step_0: Fill in the form with your intelligence data like name, description and language
create_intelligence_forms.step_1: Choose categories for your intelligence, based on the area in which it will be used, and submit.

training.step_0:
Go to the feature training!
Here you will add sentences and sort words to train your intelligence
training.step_1:
Enter a sentence here that you would like your intelligence to understand.
Then select one of the words to classify. Ex: I want a pizza
training.step_2: Now click here to sort the word you selected.
training.step_3: And write the rating Ex: If you selected ''pizza'' the rating could be ''food''
training.step_4: Identify the intention of the phrase you typed. Ex: order
training.step_6:
After adding the phrases, click here.
Tip: To train, you must have add at least two intentions with two sentences each.
training.step_7:
Make sure your intelligence is ready to train and click "Proceed".

Tip : If any requirements are not met, click " Cancel " to repeat.

evaluate.step_0:
Go to the feature test!
With the test you will be able to evaluate the performance of your intelligence easily
evaluate.step_2:
Enter a sentence here that you would like to test.
Ex: I want a pizza
evaluate.step_3: And here, select the intent that most identifies with the phrase you typed. Ex: affirmative
evaluate.step_5:
Click here to run your test.
Tip: To test you must have add at least two intentions with two sentences each.

evaluate_result.step_0: Here you can see the result of your intelligence test.

quick_test.step_0:
This's the feature quick test!
Here you can quickly test the sentences add to the training.
quick_test.step_1: Enter your test phrase and confirm.
quick_test.step_2: Click here to find out each word's relevance in the sentence within the chosen intention
quick_test.step_3: Click here to see the Raw.

inbox.step_0:
This's the feature inbox!
Here you can add phrases from user interactions with your intelligence in training or test.
inbox.step_1: Select the sentences you want to add
inbox.step_4: Select the intent that you want to assign the sentence and add.

translate.step_0:
Let's to translate!
Click here to translate the sentences of your intelligence into another language.
translate.step_1:
Select the trained language.
Tip: You need to have phrases added in that language.
translate.step_2: Select the language for translation and enter.
translate.step_3: Choose one sentence and click in translate.
translate.step_6: If you prefer, you can also export and import excel sentences for translation by clicking here

integrate.step_0:
The feature integrations!
With this feature you will be able to integrate your intelligence into a platform.
integrate.step_1: Copy this template in CURL, Python, or Javascript format for integration.

tutorial_button.step_0:
You finished!
If you want you can watch the tutorial again by clicking here.

word_suggestion.title: Variation suggestion
word_suggestion.subtitle: Generate new sentences by varying training sentences.
word_suggestion.phrase_added: Phrase added to the waiting for training list | Phrases added to the waiting for training list
word_suggestion.tooltip_alert: The suggested words are generated through contexts taken from the internet, so there may be suggestions that are beyond the control of our team.

import_and_export_intelligence.title: Import/Export your intelligence
import_and_export_intelligence.subtitle: To import/migrate, simply select the file corresponding to Rasa or place the token of Wit.AI, and the data will be recognized automatically

migrate_intelligence.title: Migrate Wit.AI
migrate_intelligence.token_input: Enter your Server Access Token here

import_dataset.title: Import Dataset
import_dataset.import_error: Something went wrong, try again later.
import_dataset.import_sentences_success_message: Imported sentences have been added for training. üòâ
import_dataset.import_sentences_error_message: Something went wrong, please try again later.

weni_notification.title: Bothub is now Weni Artificial Intelligence
weni_notification.subtitle: New module that will be available on our unified platform soon.

flow.title: Select flow
flow.sub_title: Select the flow you want to add to the action

descriptions.title: Add action to the flow
descriptions.sub_title: Explain your flow and when the user should enter it. Try to be objective.
descriptions.label: Describe the action
descriptions.change_sub_title: The description helps the Brain work better

remove.title: Remove action
remove.description:
Are you sure you want to remove the {name} action?

This action cannot be reversed

cant_access.title: Ops, you can not use this module yet
cant_access.description:
To integrate an artificial intelligence into your project, you need to have a conversation flow created.
Come back after creating a flow.

first_step.description:
1. In the ‚ÄúCommunity Intelligence Gallery‚Äù tab, choose the option that best suits your project.
2. Click on the ‚Äú+‚Äù button to integrate the Artificial Intelligence into your project.
3. Done! Now the intelligence will be available for use in the Weni Fluxos module.
4. Access the flows module on the Weni platform.

second_step.description:
5. Choose the flow of your choice and use the ‚ÄúDivide by Intent‚Äù card.
6. Select the intelligence you integrated before, and choose the intent criteria the chatbot should use.
7. Great! Now your chatbot can talk to people smarter and more effectively with the new intelligence.

customization.title: Agent persona
customization.sub_title: Profile of your intelligent agent. This is where you'll enter its characteristics and behaviors.
customization.invalid_get_data: Error trying to get the data

instructions.title: General instructions
instructions.sub_title: How you want the agent to behave. Example: You're funny but you don't make jokes.

modals.title: Remove instruction
modals.description: Are you sure you want to remove the instruction?
